recipes.name: Quinoa Salad
instructions: Rinse the quinoa under running water.
In a pot, add the quinoa and water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat, cover the pot, and cook for about 15 minutes, until the water is absorbed.
Let the quinoa cool.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked quinoa with the remaining ingredients.
Season with olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Serve cold.

recipes.name: Green Smoothie
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Fish Tacos
ingredients: 400g fish fillet (tilapia or other white fish)
instructions: Season the fish with cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Grill the fish for about 3-4 minutes on each side, until cooked through.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet or microwave.
Assemble the tacos by placing the fish in the tortillas and topping with cabbage, carrot, avocado, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice before serving.

recipes.name: Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar, mix the oats, almond milk, chia seeds, and honey.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Before serving, add the berries and sliced almonds.

recipes.name: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot.
Add the onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add the carrots, celery, zucchini, and sauté for a few more minutes.
Add the kale, tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Curry with Vegetables
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot.
Add the onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add the chicken and cook until it starts to brown.
Add the curry powder and mix well.
Add the red bell pepper, zucchini, and carrot, and sauté for a few minutes.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the chicken and vegetables are cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Bites
instructions: Peel and cook the sweet potatoes until tender.
Mash the sweet potatoes and let them cool slightly.
Mix in the egg, oat flour, cheese (if using), salt, pepper, garlic powder, and cumin.
Form small bites with the mixture and place them on a greased baking sheet.
Bake at 200°C (400°F) for about 25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown.

recipes.name: Greek Yogurt with Honey and Nuts
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, and pistachios)
instructions: Spoon the Greek yogurt into a bowl.
Drizzle with honey.
Top with mixed nuts and fresh berries if desired.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds.
In a bowl, mix the cooked rice, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the bell peppers with the mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Top with shredded cheese if using.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the peppers are tender.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast
instructions: Toast the bread slices to your desired level of crispiness.
Mash the avocado in a bowl and mix in lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread the avocado mixture evenly over the toasted bread.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and fresh herbs if desired.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chickpea Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, and feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Squash with Marinara
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds.
Drizzle the inside with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and place cut-side down on a baking sheet.
Roast for 40-45 minutes, or until tender.
Use a fork to scrape the flesh into spaghetti-like strands.
Top with marinara sauce and Parmesan cheese.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Lemon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.
Garnish with lemon slices before serving.

recipes.name: Quinoa Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, bell pepper, onion, and cheese if using.
Stuff each mushroom cap with the quinoa mixture.
Place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender.
Garnish with fresh thyme before serving.

recipes.name: Roasted Chickpeas
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Pat the chickpeas dry with a paper towel.
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, shaking the pan halfway through, until crispy.
Cool before serving.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Rice Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, bell peppers)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and mixed vegetables, and sauté until vegetables are tender.
Add riced cauliflower and soy sauce, and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

recipes.name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for about 3-4 minutes, until tender.
Stir in basil pesto and cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with cherry tomatoes and Parmesan cheese if desired.

recipes.name: Turkey Meatballs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a large bowl, mix ground turkey, Parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, egg, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Form into 1-inch meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through.
Serve with marinara sauce.

recipes.name: Almond Butter Banana Bites
instructions: Slice the bananas into 1/2-inch rounds.
Spread almond butter on half of the banana slices.
Top with the remaining banana slices to form sandwiches.
Melt dark chocolate chips and dip each sandwich into the chocolate.
Sprinkle with coconut flakes if desired.
Refrigerate until chocolate is set.

recipes.name: Mango Chia Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, mix chia seeds, coconut milk, and honey.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Stir the pudding well before serving.
Top with diced mango and garnish with mint leaves.
